contextId.information: The word here "empty-handed" is used to emphasize the opposite meaning. AT: "will go with your hands full of good things" or "will go with many valuable things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
This can be stated in positive form. AT: "you must begin to deal truthfully with us and let our people go" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: you must not deal deceitfully any more by not letting our people go

contextId.information: "I will certainly consider guilty" or "I will certainly punish" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
This can be stated in a positive form. AT: "he must give the first wife the same food, clothing, and marital rights she had before" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: he must not diminish her food, clothing, or her marital rights

contextId.information: This can be stated in positive form. AT: "You must treat all widows and fatherless children fairly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: You must not mistreat any widow or fatherless child

contextId.information: This can be stated in a positive form. AT: "You must bring all of your offerings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: You must not hold back offerings

contextId.information: This can be stated in positive form. AT: "Every woman will be able to become pregnant and give birth to healthy babies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: No woman will be barren or will miscarry her young in your land
